attributes.action: ensure a change in the Race Relations Law
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Section 19C of the Race Relations (Amendment) Act 2000 exempts courts and employment tribunals from the dictates of the Race Relations Law.

We the Petitioners humbly ask the Prime minister to ensure an introduction of legislation to bring the judiciary and tribunals within the scope of Section 19B of the Race Relations (Amendment) Act 2000.  

As the exceptions are;

A) Not in keeping with        
(i)Our Confirmation of Liberties 
(Magna Carter 1297(c9) :-

“FIRST, We have granted to God, and by this our present Charter have confirmed, for Us and our Heirs for ever,..We have granted also, and given to all the Freemen of our Realm, for Us and our Heirs for ever, these Liberties under-written, to have and to hold to them and their Heirs, of Us and our Heirs for ever.”

(ii)& The Spirit of the Articles 1,2,3,7,8 and 10 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights 1948.

B)Not needed as there are ANTI-TERROR laws to safeguard the nation.

A House of Commons petition has already been submitted (Jan 2007).

reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
